segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, seemingly lost in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She looks so focused on that plate, like nothing else matters right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but notice the water pouring over the edge of the sink, forming a puddle below.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not hear the splashing sound?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost mesmerizing, the way the water cascades down the cabinet doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a bit anxious thinking about the mess that might soon happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Then, there are the children, quietly sneaking around, which is both adorable and alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR
